intro: Epilobium lineare f. pennsylvanicum, commonly known as the Pennsylvania willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by slender, willow-like stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink to reddish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands, stream banks, and meadows. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
